Posts.Content: It is a difficult to time, for your mom and the rest of the family. Just give your mom loads of support and know that she is as scared as you are. It is not a death sentance! And encourage your mom to do enough research before she decides on any treatment options. Strongs to you and your family.
Posts.Title: just found out my mom has breast cancer

Posts.Content: It could really be something very simple.... please have it checked. One cant worry about something if you dont know what it is - you could be causing yourself unnesssary stress. good luck xx
Posts.Title: Scared to get checked

Posts.Content: I have had some weird sensations in my breast and something what could be described as a shooting pain, my oncologist told me that its nerves. Because they cause a lot of nerve damage during surgery and now the nerves ''wake up'' so to speak. It could also be the scar that is sensitive now due to the radiation. My thoughts..
Posts.Title: sharp pin like jab in previous cancer breast.

Posts.Content: Im replying to this now because I too will never recommend chemo or radition to anyone. The side effects are not worth it and you cannot go by the stats because they are not accurate. Its absolute poisen to your body and Im sorry that I have considered this route. I was bullied into thinking it was my only option. It is not.
Posts.Title: Rib pain months after radiation stops

Posts.Content: On Nov 04, 2014 3:07 AM lsslondon wrote: On Oct 13, 2014 2:58 AM Stead5 wrote: Did your oncologist offer you an oncotype dx test using the breast tissue removed during surgery? the test is used to determine the likelihood of the same cancer reoccurring in your breast and if chemo would be beneficial in treating your cancer..also..you didn't mention if there was cancer in any of your lymph nodes..or if your treatment consisted of chemo or radiation or both...I am doing 30 radiation treatments..cancer in one lymph mode..had lumpectomy..scored 9 on oncotype dx test so didn't have to do chemo...oncologist has recommended Arimidex hormonal treatment for five years but I'm not sure I will do it...I already have joint pain and sure don't need anymore...would love to hear the treatment your doctors have planned for you in case mine comes back...will keep you in my prayers.. My sister had breast cancer 10 years ago. Last year it came back and now in her bones, stomach and intestines. She can't eat solid food because the food can't be digested. She has nausea and vomiting. Help!                               Suzy Reoccurance seems common although the oncologists dont like to say much about it - infact I dont care for their stats. I had 4 months of chemo only for the cancer to come back - 2 months later.....in the same breast, same spot (after having a mastectomy). The doctors tell me they may not have removed all the tissue and cells escaped..... I am now having radiation. The thing that makes me so mad is that the chemo and radiation can cause other cancers. So you fighting a devil with another devil. And I truly believe now that cancer is not cureable, however, containable. Like in your sisters case, she contained it for 10 years..... now its come back with a vengeance. I pray that there is still a treatment plan available to her and that she makes the wise choices. God Bless her!
Posts.Title: Recurrence of the same breast cancer
